010package imagingbook.common.corners;
011
012import java.awt.Shape;
013import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018
019
020/**
021 * This class represents a 2D corner.
022 * A corner is essentially a {@link Pnt2d} plus a scalar quantity
023 * {@link #q} for the corner strength.
024 * 
025 * @version 2020/10/02
026 */
027public class Corner implements Pnt2d, Comparable<Corner> {
028        
029        private final float x, y;
030        private final float q;
031
032        public Corner(float x, float y, float q) {
033                this.x = x;
034                this.y = y;
035                this.q = q;
036        }
037        
038        @Override
039        public double getX() {
040                return x;
041        }
042
043        @Override
044        public double getY() {
045                return y;
046        }
047
048        public double getQ() {
049                return q;
050        }
051
052        // used for sorting corners by corner strength q
053        @Override
054        public int compareTo(Corner other) {
055                return Float.compare(other.q, this.q);
056        }
057        
058        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
059        
060        @Override
061        public String toString() {
062                return String.format(Locale.US, "Corner <%.3f, %.3f, %.3f>", x, y, q);
063        }
064        
065        
066        @Override
067        public Shape getShape(double size) {
068                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
069                path.moveTo(x - size, y);
070                path.lineTo(x + size, y);
071                path.moveTo(x, y - size);
072                path.lineTo(x, y + size);
073                return path;
074        }
075        
076        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
077
078        public static void main(String[] args) {
079                Corner c1 = new Corner(1,0,1);
080                Corner c2 = new Corner(2,0,2);
081                Corner c3 = new Corner(3,0,3);
082                Corner c4 = new Corner(4,0,2);
083                
084                Corner[] corners = {c1, c2, c3, c4};
085                System.out.println("corners orig =   " + Arrays.toString(corners));
086                
087                Arrays.sort(corners);
088                System.out.println("corners sorted = " + Arrays.toString(corners));
089        }
090}
091
